text: is a Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Ugajin was born in Toda on March 23, 1988. After graduating from Ryutsu Keizai University, he joined J1 League club Urawa Reds in 2010. He played many matches as left side back from first season. Urawa won the 2nd place in the 2014 and 2016 J1 League. In 2017, Urawa won the champions the 2017 AFC Champions League. Urawa also won the 2nd place in the 2019 AFC Champions League. On March 23, 2018, Ugajin debuted for the Japan national team against Mali. ==Club statistics== Updated to 20 December 2022.Nippon Sports Kikaku Publishing inc./日本スポーツ企画出版社, "J1&J2;&J3;選手名鑑ハンディ版 2018 (NSK MOOK)", 7 February 2018, Japan, (p. 56 out of 289)Nippon Sports Kikaku Publishing inc./日本スポーツ企画出版社, "2017 J1&J2;&J3;選手名鑑 (NSK MOOK)", 8 February 2017, Japan, (p. 16 out of 289) Club Season League Cup1 League Cup2 AFC Other3 Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Ryutsu Keizai University F.C. 2006 Japan Football League 2 0 0 0 – – – 2 0 2007 1 0 0 0 – – – 1 0 2008 18 2 2 1 – – – 20 3 2009 10 3 1 0 – – – 11 3 Total 31 5 3 1 – – – 34 6 Urawa Red Diamonds 2009 J.
